alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 08 at 11:56AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by glacial dammed lake release is expected. * WHERE...Cooper Landing through Skilak Lake * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain across the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - For Kenai River at Cooper Landing: At 11:00am the stage was 11.67 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 15.6 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 12.5 feet: Water starts to flow over Primrose Road on the southern end of Kenai Lake. At 14.0 feet: Properties along the Sterling Highway miles 48-50 begin to see water in their yards. USGS gauge house adjacent to Cooper Landing bridge will begin to flood. Bottom of wooden walkway at boat ramp starts to be submerged. At 15.0 feet: Quartz Creek Campground boat ramp submerged and water encroaches campsites that are located next to the lake. Water should start to approach foundation level of buildings along Sterling Highway miles 48-50. North Cooper Creek Campgrounds begins to flood. Water in slough at mile 54 will encroach the Sterling Highway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The glacial dammed release will cause high water and swift flows for walk-in wade fishing and drift boat/raft maneuvering. Caution is advised for rising water levels and wear personal flotation devices.
